translation.ja: レヴィーが 気もそぞろなのが悪い

translation.en: Now we gotta see if that boy can get that part right.
translation.ja: 口上も録り直しだ

translation.en: He got one eye on the gal and the other on his trumpet.
translation.ja: レヴィーは女にうつつを

translation.en: [Cutler] Nigga, don't you know that's Ma's gal?
translation.ja: マの女だぞ

translation.en: I ain't done nothing to her. I just talk to her like I talk to anybody else.
translation.ja: 話しただけだ　普通にな

translation.en: Your ass gonna be out there scraping the concrete, lookin' for a job, you keep messing around with her.
translation.ja: 仕事を失ってもいいのか？

translation.en: I ain't done nothing to the gal. I just asked her her name. If you sayin' I can't do that, Ma'll just have to go to hell.
translation.ja: 名前を聞くのもダメなら マ･レイニーは地獄へ落ちろ

translation.en: I'm through with it. [scoffs] Try talking to a fool.
translation.ja: これ以上 バカと話せん

translation.en: Some mens got it worse than others. Some mens is excited to be a fool.
translation.ja: バカをやるのが 好きな奴もいる

translation.en: I knows about it. The excitement is something else.
translation.ja: 俺も経験したから分かる

translation.en: I done experienced it. Make you feel good to be a fool.
translation.ja: バカげた振る舞いは楽しい

translation.en: But it don't last long. Over in a minute, then you got to tend with the consequences.
translation.ja: だが興奮は続かんし 責任も取らんといかん

translation.en: That's the best sense you made all day, talking about being a fool.
translation.ja: やっと まともなことを

translation.en: That's the only sensible thing you said today, admitting you was a fool.
translation.ja: 自分がバカだと認めるのか

translation.en: Oh, I admits it, all right. Ain't nothing wrong with it.
translation.ja: 認めるさ　悪いことじゃない

translation.en: I done been a little bit of everything. [chuckles] Gonna be a bit more things before I'm finished with it.
translation.ja: いろいろ試したし 何でもやってみるつもりだが

translation.en: But I ain't never been the same fool twice. That's where we part ways.
translation.ja: お前と違い 同じバカは繰り返さん

translation.en: But you been a fool. That's what counts.
translation.ja: でも バカをやった

translation.en: Talking about I'm a fool for asking the girl her name, and here you is one yourself.
translation.ja: なのに俺をバカ呼ばわりかよ

translation.en: I married a woman. A good woman. To this day, I can't say nothing bad about this woman.
translation.ja: 俺は非の打ち所がない女性を 嫁にもらった

translation.en: I married her with all the good intentions and graces of being hooked up,
translation.ja: 彼女だけを大切にし― 一生を捧げ 死ぬまで 添い遂げるつもりだった

translation.en: bound to her for the rest of my life. Looking for this woman to put me in my grave,
translation.ja: 一生を捧げ 死ぬまで 添い遂げるつもりだった

translation.en: but she went out and joined the church.
translation.ja: だが彼女は教会で―

translation.en: She got up there and got to seeing them good Christian men
translation.ja: “善きキリスト教徒の男”に 出会った

translation.en: and wondering why I ain't like that.
translation.ja: 俺と奴を比較して―

translation.en: Soon she figured she hooked up to a heathen. Couldn't live like that.
translation.ja: 俺が異教徒だと気づき 耐えられなくなり―

translation.en: So she left.
translation.ja: 出てったよ

translation.en: I just sat down and I figured I was a fool
translation.ja: 俺は座って考えた 彼女の不満に 気づかなかった俺はバカだ

translation.en: not to see that she needed something that I wasn't giving her,
translation.ja: 彼女の不満に 気づかなかった俺はバカだ

translation.en: else she wouldn't have been up there at the church.
translation.ja: だから彼女は入信を

translation.en: So, yeah… Toledo been a fool about a woman.
translation.ja: 俺は 女心を分からん バカだったんだ

translation.en: That's part of making life.
translation.ja: それも人生だ

translation.en: Toledo, what you call a fool and what I call a fool are two different things.
translation.ja: お前は 俺の言うバカとは違う

translation.en: A fool is responsible for what happen to him.
translation.ja: 俺の言うバカは 自ら 問題を招き寄せる連中だ

translation.en: A fool cause it to happen. Like Levee.
translation.ja: 俺の言うバカは 自ら 問題を招き寄せる連中だ レヴィーは―

translation.en: He keep messing around with Ma's gal, his feet be out there scraping the ground.
translation.ja: マ･レイニーの女に手を出し 今にマズいことに

translation.en: -That's a fool. -Nothing gonna happen to Levee. Levee ain't gonna let nothing happen to him.
translation.ja: マズいことになるわけない

translation.en: Better not let Ma see you ask her. That's what the man's trying to tell you.
translation.ja: 彼はただ用心しろと

translation.en: I don't need nobody to tell me nothing.
translation.ja: 大きなお世話だ

translation.en: Toledo, all I'm saying is, from the looks of it, from your story, I don't think life treated you fair.
translation.ja: トレド　お前は人生に 冷たくされただけだ

translation.en: Oh, life's fair.
translation.ja: 人生は平等だ

translation.en: Life ain't shit. You can put it in a paper bag and carry it around with you. -It ain't got no balls. -[door clangs]
translation.ja: 人生は 袋に押し込まれても 抵抗さえしない

translation.en: Now death? Death got some style.
translation.ja: だが死には力がある

translation.en: Death will kick your ass and make you wish you never been born. That's how bad death is.
translation.ja: 生まれたことを 後悔させる力がな

translation.en: But you can rule over life. Life ain't nothing. Nigga talking about life is fair and ain't got a pot to piss in.
translation.ja: 人生は平等だと？ 貧乏暮らしでよく言うよ

translation.en: All right. Now I'm gonna tell you something. A nigga gonna be dissatisfied no matter what.
translation.ja: 黒人は何を与えられても 不満ばかりだ

translation.en: Niggas got a right to be dissatisfied.
translation.ja: それも当然だろ

translation.en: Is you gonna be satisfied with a bone somebody done throwed you when you done seen them eating a whole hog?
translation.ja: 豚を丸ごと食う奴がいるのに 骨１本で満足か？

translation.en: You lucky they let you be an entertainer. You're lucky and don't even know it.
translation.ja: お前は十分 恵まれてる

translation.en: I'm talking about being satisfied with a bone somebody done throwed you.
translation.ja: 骨１本で満足かと 聞いてるんだ

translation.en: That's what's the matter with y'all, you're satisfied sitting in one place.
translation.ja: 皆 今の場所から 動こうとしない

translation.en: Soon as I get my band together and record them songs Mr. Sturdyvant done told me I can make,
translation.ja: 俺はバンドを組み レコードを出して―

translation.en: I'm gonna be like Ma and tell the white man just what he can do.
translation.ja: マ･レイニーのように 白人に命令する

translation.en: Ma tell Mr. Irvin she leaving?
translation.ja: 帰ると脅せば―

translation.en: Mr. Irvin get down on his knees and beg her to stay.
translation.ja: アーヴィンさんは 必死に止める

translation.en: That's the way I'm gonna be. Make the white man respect me.
translation.ja: 俺も必ず白人の尊敬を得る

translation.en: The white man don't care nothing about Ma. The colored folks made Ma a star.
translation.ja: 白人はマ･レイニーを 尊敬してるわけじゃない

translation.en: The white folks don't care nothing about who she is or what kind of music she make.
translation.ja: 彼女がスターだろうと 白人には関係ない

translation.en: Let her go to one of them white folks hotel and see how big she is.
translation.ja: 白人のホテルでは無視され…

translation.en: [scoffs] Hell, she can't even get a cab up here in the North.
translation.ja: タクシーも拾えない

translation.en: I'mma tell you something. Reverend Gates.
translation.ja: ゲイツ牧師の話を？

translation.en: Slow Drag, you know who I'm talking about. Reverend Gates.
translation.ja: スロー･ドラッグ 分かるな？

translation.en: Reverend Gates was, uh, coming up from Tallahassee to Atlanta
translation.ja: 彼はタラハシーから アトランタへ―

translation.en: to see his sister who was sick at that time with the consumption.
translation.ja: 結核の家族の 見舞いに向かった

translation.en: The train come up through Thomasville, then past Moultrie, and then ended up in this little town called Sigsbee.
translation.ja: 列車はモールトリーを過ぎ シグズビーという駅に着いた

translation.en: You can stop telling that right there.
translation.ja: ちょっと待て

translation.en: Ain't but one train come out of Tallahassee headed north to Atlanta. It don't stop at Sigsbee.
translation.ja: タラハシー発の列車は シグズビーに止まらない

translation.en: The only train that stop at Sigsbee is the Santa Fe, and you gotta transfer at Moultrie to get it.
translation.ja: サンタフェ行きの列車に 乗り換えないと

translation.en: Maybe that's what he done. I don't know. I'm just telling you he got off at Sigsbee.
translation.ja: とにかく彼は シグズビーで降りた

translation.en: You telling it. Tell it your way. Just make up anything.
translation.ja: 好きにでっち上げろ

translation.en: Leave him alone and let him finish.
translation.ja: 最後まで聞け

translation.en: Go on, tell it your way.
translation.ja: 話すがいい

translation.en: Reverend Gates got off this train in Sigsbee.
translation.ja: 牧師はシグズビーで降り―

translation.en: Figured he'd check the schedule to make sure he arrived in time for somebody to pick him up. All right?
translation.ja: 迎えに間に合うかと 時刻表を確認した

translation.en: While he's there, it come upon him that he had to go to the bathroom.
translation.ja: そのうち 用を足したくなってきた

translation.en: Now, the only colored restroom they had
translation.ja: 黒人用の便所は―

translation.en: was an outhouse they had sitting way back, 200 yards or so from the train station.
translation.ja: 駅から200メートルほど 離れてて

translation.en: While he's in the outhouse, the train go off and leave without him.
translation.ja: 彼が便所にいる間に 列車が出てしまった

translation.en: Now, he don't know where he is in this town.
translation.ja: 彼が便所にいる間に 列車が出てしまった 名前も初めて知った駅に 取り残されたんだ

translation.en: In fact, he ain't never heard of it before.
translation.ja: 名前も初めて知った駅に 取り残されたんだ

translation.en: I heard of it, and he ain't got off no train coming outta Tallahassee in Sigsbee.
translation.ja: タラハシーからの列車は 止まらない

translation.en: The man's standing there trying to figure out what he gonna do, where this train done left him in this strange town.
translation.ja: この見知らぬ土地で どうすべきか彼は考えた

translation.en: It started getting dark. He sees where the sun's getting low in the sky, and he's trying to figure out what he gonna do,
translation.ja: 太陽が沈み始め 辺りは だんだん暗くなってくる

translation.en: when he noticed a couple of white fellas standing across the street from the station.
translation.ja: その時 ２人の白人に気づいた

translation.en: Just standing there, watching him.
translation.ja: ２人は彼を見てた

translation.en: Then two or three more fellas come up and join the other one.
translation.ja: さらに２～３人 増えた

translation.en: Now he look around the station. He don't see no colored folks nowhere.
translation.ja: 周りを見ても 黒人は１人もいない

translation.en: He don't know what's getting into these fellas' minds, so he commence to walking.
translation.ja: 彼は白人を警戒して 歩き始めた

translation.en: He don't know where he walking. He walking down the railroad tracks
translation.ja: 線路沿いを歩いていると 聞こえてきた

translation.en: when he hear, "Hey, nigger."
translation.ja: 線路沿いを歩いていると 聞こえてきた “おい お前”

translation.en: Just like that.
translation.ja: そんな声だ

translation.en: "Hey, nigger."
translation.ja: “おい お前”

translation.en: He keep walking.
translation.ja: 彼は歩いた

translation.en: They call him some more. He kept walking.
translation.ja: 何度 言われても歩き続けた

translation.en: Then he heard a gunshot. Yeah. He stopped then, you know.
translation.ja: だが銃声が聞こえて 足を止めると―

translation.en: They crowded around him. He's standing there,
translation.ja: すぐさま連中に取り囲まれた

translation.en: cross around his neck, and the little Bible that he keep with him all the time.
translation.ja: 首に十字架をかけ 手に聖書を持った彼は―

translation.en: They ask who he was. He said he was Reverend Gates
translation.ja: 名前を聞かれ “ゲイツ牧師だ”と

translation.en: and he was on his way to see his sister who was sick, and the train went off and left him.
translation.ja: “見舞いに行く途中 列車に遅れた”と

translation.en: And they said, "Yeah, nigger?"
translation.ja: 連中は― “そうかい お前 踊れるか？”と

translation.en: "But can you dance?"
translation.ja: “そうかい お前 踊れるか？”と

translation.en: He looked at them and commenced to dancing.
translation.ja: 彼は連中の顔を見て 踊り出した

translation.en: One of them reached up and tore his cross off his neck,
translation.ja: 連中は“十字架をかけて 踊るのは冒とくだ”と―

translation.en: said he was committing heresy by dancing with a cross and a Bible.
translation.ja: 連中は“十字架をかけて 踊るのは冒とくだ”と― 首から引きちぎった

translation.en: Took his Bible and tore it up,
translation.ja: 聖書も破り捨てた

translation.en: and had him dancing till they got tired of watching him.
translation.ja: そして見飽きるまで踊らせた

translation.en: -That's the only way that man-- -What I wants to know is, he a man of God.
translation.ja: それだけが… １つ聞く 彼は聖職者なんだろ その間 神は何してた？

translation.en: Where the hell was God when all this was going on?
translation.ja: 彼は聖職者なんだろ その間 神は何してた？

translation.en: Why didn't God strike down them crackers with some of this lightning you talking about to me?
translation.ja: さっき あんたが言ってた 雷の出番だ

translation.en: Levee, you gonna burn in hell.
translation.ja: 地獄で焼かれろ

translation.en: Why didn't God strike some of them crackers down? Tell me that.
translation.ja: なぜ神は白人を 雷で打たなかった？

translation.en: That's the question. Don't come telling me this burning-in-hell shit.
translation.ja: なぜ神は白人を 雷で打たなかった？ 地獄で焼かれろだと？

translation.en: He a man of God, why didn't God strike some of them crackers down?
translation.ja: なぜ神は その聖職者を守らない？

translation.en: I'll tell you why. I'll tell you the truth.
translation.ja: 教えてやる これが真実だ

translation.en: God ain't never listened to no nigga's prayers. God take the nigga's prayers and throw them in the garbage.
translation.ja: 神は黒人の祈りを ゴミ箱に捨ててる

translation.en: God don't pay niggas no mind. In fact, God hate niggas.
translation.ja: 黒人に 興味がないどころか― 黒人を心の底から 憎んでるんだ

translation.en: Hate them with all the fury in his heart.
translation.ja: 黒人を心の底から 憎んでるんだ

translation.en: Jesus don't love you, nigga. Jesus hate your black ass.
translation.ja: イエスは黒人を嫌ってる

translation.en: Come talking that shit to me. Talking about burning in hell.
translation.ja: 何が“地獄で焼かれろ”だ

translation.en: God can kiss my ass.
translation.ja: 神のクソ野郎

translation.en: You wanna blaspheme my God! That's my God! My God, you worthless--
translation.ja: 俺の神を冒とくするな！ このクズめ

translation.en: Let him go! -You worthless! -Let him go!
translation.ja: いいさ　止めるな

translation.en: -That's my God! Blaspheme my God. -Let it go! It don't mean nothing!
translation.ja: クズめ！ 落ち着け あいつも本気じゃない

translation.en: It don't mean nothing!
translation.ja: 落ち着け あいつも本気じゃない

translation.en: It's your God, huh? Is that right?
translation.ja: あんたの神ね　なるほど

translation.en: All right, I'm gonna give your God a chance.
translation.ja: 神にチャンスをやる

translation.en: I'm gonna give your God a chance.
translation.ja: 絶好のチャンスだ

translation.en: I'm gonna give him a chance to save your black ass.
translation.ja: 神に救ってもらえるかな

translation.en: -Put that knife up! -Stay out of this, Toledo.
translation.ja: 来るな やめとけ

translation.en: -That's no way to solve nothing. -Put that knife up!
translation.ja: レヴィー

translation.en: I'm talking to Cutler's God! You hear me?
translation.ja: カトラーの神に話してる 聞こえるか

translation.en: Cutler's God! I'm calling Cutler's God!
translation.ja: カトラーの神に話してる 聞こえるか カトラーの神よ

translation.en: Come on and save this nigga.
translation.ja: こいつを救え

translation.en: Strike me down before I cut his throat.
translation.ja: 俺を雷で打て

translation.en: -You gonna burn in hell, nigga. -I'm calling your God.
translation.ja: 地獄へ行け あんたの神に 守ってもらうがいい

translation.en: I'm gonna give him a chance to save you. I'm calling your God!
translation.ja: あんたの神に 守ってもらうがいい あんたの神を呼ぼう

translation.en: Cutler's God? Come on and save this nigga.
translation.ja: カトラーの神 こいつを救ってやれ

translation.en: Come on and save him like you did my mama.
translation.ja: お袋を救ったみたいに

translation.en: Save him like you did my mama!
translation.ja: お袋を救ったみたいに！

translation.en: I heard her when she call you.
translation.ja: お袋は神に祈った

translation.en: I heard her when she said, "Lord have mercy. Jesus help me."
translation.ja: “主よ お慈悲を イエスよ　助けたまえ”

translation.en: "Please, God, have mercy on me, Lord. Jesus help me."
translation.ja: “主よ　ご慈悲を イエスよ　助けたまえ”

translation.en: Did you turn your back?
translation.ja: だが無視したな？

translation.en: Did you turn your back, motherfucker?
translation.ja: 背中を向けたんだろ？

translation.en: Did you turn your back?
translation.ja: どうなんだ

translation.en: Come on.
translation.ja: さあ

translation.en: Come on and turn your back on me.
translation.ja: 俺にも背中を向けろ

translation.en: Turn your back on me!
translation.ja: 向けるがいい

translation.en: Come on. Where is you?
translation.ja: どこにいる？

translation.en: Come on and turn your back on me!
translation.ja: 背中を向けるんだ

translation.en: Turn your back on me, motherfucker! I'll cut your heart out!
translation.ja: 背中を向けろ 心臓をえぐってやる

translation.en: Come on. What's the matter? Where is you?
translation.ja: 何だよ どうした どこにいる？

translation.en: Come on and turn your back on me.
translation.ja: 背中を向けろ

translation.en: Come on, what you scared of?
translation.ja: おじけづいたか？

translation.en: Turn your back on me! Come on!
translation.ja: 俺に背中を向けてみろ どうした！

translation.en: Coward motherfucker!
translation.ja: 腰抜けのクソ野郎

translation.en: Your God ain't shit, Cutler.
translation.ja: あんたの神は―

translation.en: Your God ain't shit.
translation.ja: 役立たずだ

translation.en: Wonderful. We got that, boys.
translation.ja: 大成功だ

translation.en: Good session, Ma. We've got ourselves some winners!
translation.ja: 大ヒット間違いなし

translation.en: Slow Drag, where you learn to play that bass at? I heard it singing. I heard you. You had that bass jumping all over the place.
translation.ja: スロー･ドラッグ　ベースが まるで歌って踊ってたね

translation.en: I was following Toledo. Nigga got them long fingers striding all over the piano.
translation.ja: トレドに 必死で食らいついたんだ

translation.en: -I was trying to keep up with him. -That's what you supposed to do.
translation.ja: トレドに 必死で食らいついたんだ これが音楽だよな

translation.en: -Play the music. -Cutler, you hear Slow Drag on that bass spanking like you spank a baby?
translation.ja: 見事にベースを 打ち鳴らしてた

translation.en: Levee, what were you doing? Why you playing all them notes? Playing ten notes for every one you supposed to play. Don't call for all that.
translation.ja: レヴィーは音が多すぎた 10倍も飾らなくていい

translation.en: You're supposed to improvise on the theme. That's what I was doing.
translation.ja: 即興で味をつけた

translation.en: You're supposed to play the song like I sing it. [chuckling] The way everybody else play it.
translation.ja: 私の歌や みんなの演奏に合わせな

translation.en: I was playing the song the way I felt it.
translation.ja: 感じたまま音楽を

translation.en: I'm trying to sing my song and you messing up my ear.
translation.ja: 耳障りだと言ってるんだ あれが“音楽”？

translation.en: -You call that playing music? -Hey, I know what I'm doing.
translation.ja: 耳障りだと言ってるんだ あれが“音楽”？ 俺の音楽だ ケチつけないでくれ

translation.en: Y'all back up and leave me alone about my music.
translation.ja: 俺の音楽だ ケチつけないでくれ

translation.en: I done told you it ain't about your music. It's about Ma's music.
translation.ja: マ･レイニーの音楽だ

translation.en: That's all right. I told you what to do.
translation.ja: まあ じきに…

translation.en: What I care about what you and Cutler do?
translation.ja: 好きにするがいい

translation.en: Y'all gonna fire me. I don't care. I'll go get my own band anyway.
translation.ja: クビにしろ　バンドを組む

translation.en: -You keep messing with me-- -Nobody studying you.
translation.ja: あんた… うるさい

translation.en: All right, nigga. You fired.
translation.ja: そうか　じゃあクビだ

translation.en: You think I care about being fired? I don't care.
translation.ja: 落ち込むと？ むしろ助かった

translation.en: -You doing me a favor. -Cutler, Levee's out.
translation.ja: 落ち込むと？ むしろ助かった カトラー　彼はクビだ

translation.en: -He ain't playing in my band no more. -I'm fired? Good!
translation.ja: カトラー　彼はクビだ クビか　上等だ

translation.en: Best thing that ever happened to me. I don't need this shit.
translation.ja: 願ったりかなったりだよ こんな仕事 要らねえ

translation.en: Mel will be out with your money in a minute.
translation.ja: メルが報酬を

translation.en: That's cash money. I don't want no check.
translation.ja: 小切手ではなく現金で

translation.en: I'll see what I can do. I can't promise you nothing.
translation.ja: 伝えるが確約はできん

translation.en: As long as it ain't no check. I ain't got no use for a check.
translation.ja: 小切手は困ります

translation.en: Listen, Ma. I talked to Sturdyvant, and he said…
translation.ja: マ･レイニー メルと話した 私は反対してるんだが…

translation.en: Now I tried to talk him out of it,
translation.ja: 私は反対してるんだが…

translation.en: but he said the best he can do is take $25 of your money and give it to Sylvester.
translation.ja: あなたの報酬から25ドル シルヴェスターに渡すと

translation.en: Take what and do what?
translation.ja: 何だって？

translation.en: If I wanted the boy to have $25 of my money, I'd give it to him.
translation.ja: 甥に25ドルやりたきゃ 自分でやる

translation.en: He's supposed to have his own money. He's supposed to get paid like everybody else.
translation.ja: 甥にも報酬を出すべきだ

translation.en: You go on up there, and you tell Sturdyvant that he better pay the boy his own money.
translation.ja: この子の分も払えと 彼に言ってきな

translation.en: -Yeah, I talked to him-- -[Ma Rainey] Talk to him again.
translation.ja: だが… 払わないなら 彼の会社から 二度とレコードを出さない

translation.en: Tell him if he don't pay the boy his own money, he'll never make another record of mine again. Tell him that.
translation.ja: 払わないなら 彼の会社から 二度とレコードを出さない

translation.en: You supposed to be my manager. Always talking about sticking together. Start sticking.
translation.ja: あんたと私は味方同士だろ 味方してよ

translation.en: -Get the boy his money! -Okay.
translation.ja: 早く！ 分かった

translation.en: I'll see what I can do.
translation.ja: 話してみる

translation.en: Hey, Ma.
translation.ja: マ･レイニー

translation.en: Is there something wrong? Is there a problem?
translation.ja: 何か問題でもあったかな

translation.en: I want you to pay the boy his money.
translation.ja: 甥にも報酬を

translation.en: Sure, Ma. I got it right here.
translation.ja: ああ 持ってきた

translation.en: It's, uh, 200 for you and 25 for the kid, right?
translation.ja: あなたに200ドル 彼に25ドルだ

translation.en: Irvin misunderstood me. It was all a mistake. It was all a mistake.
translation.ja: アーヴィンの勘違いだ ミスだよ

translation.en: -A mistake, huh? -Sure, Ma. Made a mistake.
translation.ja: ミス？ だが ちゃんと 彼にも報酬が出た

translation.en: But he's paid, right?
translation.ja: だが ちゃんと 彼にも報酬が出た

translation.en: The only mistake…
translation.ja: 大きなミスだね

translation.en: was when you found out I hadn't signed the release forms. That was a mistake.
translation.ja: 譲渡証書の署名が 済んでないのにさ

translation.en: Come on. Sign the forms, huh?
translation.ja: おい 署名してくれ

translation.en: -Dussie Mae, Sylvester, come on. -Ma, sign the forms.
translation.ja: 帰る マ 頼むよ

translation.en: [Ma Rainey] Irvin, where's my car?
translation.ja: 車は？

translation.en: It's right out front. I got the keys right here.
translation.ja: すぐそこだ　キーもある

translation.en: Come on and sign these forms, huh?
translation.ja: すぐそこだ　キーもある 署名してくれ

translation.en: Irvin, give me my keys.
translation.ja: キーを渡して

translation.en: Sure, Ma. Just… sign these forms.
translation.ja: ああ　だから署名してくれ

translation.en: Send them to my address. I'll get around to 'em.
translation.ja: 自宅に郵送を

translation.en: Come on, Ma. I took care of everything, didn't I? I straightened everything out.
translation.ja: 頼むよ マ･レイニー 何もかも要望どおりにした

translation.en: Ma?
translation.ja: なあ

translation.en: Please?
translation.ja: 頼む

translation.en: And you tell Sturdyvant, any more mistakes and I can make my records someplace else.
translation.ja: 彼に“次にミスしたら レコード会社を移る”と

translation.en: [Cutler] I ain't gonna stand for it. Ain't gonna bring me no check down here.
translation.ja: 小切手は勘弁してもらいたい

translation.en: Man give me a check last time. What happened? We had to go all over Chicago to get it cashed.
translation.ja: 前回 現金化に 苦労したからな

translation.en: See a nigga with a check, first thing they think is he stole it.
translation.ja: 盗んだと思われてさ

translation.en: I ain't had no trouble cashing mine.
translation.ja: 問題なく使えた

translation.en: I don't visit no whore houses.
translation.ja: 売春宿でだろ

translation.en: You don't know my business, so don't start nothing. I'm tired of you as it is. I ain't but two seconds off your ass, noway.
translation.ja: 俺に関わらないでくれ ブチ切れる２秒手前だ

translation.en: Don't y'all start nothing now.
translation.ja: よせって

translation.en: What the hell I care what you're tired of? I wasn't talking to you.
translation.ja: 俺はトレドと話してた

translation.en: -I was talking to this man. -Boys, I've got your pay.
translation.ja: 俺はトレドと話してた 報酬だ

translation.en: Mr. Irvin told me you boys prefer cash, and that's what I have for you.
translation.ja: 現金がいいと聞いて用意した

translation.en: That was a good session you boys put in. There's 25 for you.
translation.ja: いい演奏だった　25ドル

translation.en: Yes, sir, you boys really know your business. Twenty-five for you.
translation.ja: 見事な腕をしてる　25ドル

translation.en: We're gonna get you back in here real soon. Twenty-five.
translation.ja: またすぐ呼ぶよ　25ドル

translation.en: And have another session, so you can make some more money. And 25 for you.
translation.ja: 次のセッションでも 稼いでくれ　25ドル

translation.en: [Levee] Uh, Mr. Sturdyvant, sir?
translation.ja: メルさん

translation.en: About them songs I give you?
translation.ja: 渡した曲は？

translation.en: Oh, yeah. Oh, Levee. Uh, I thought about it. I don't think that people will buy them.
translation.ja: レヴィー　考えたが 売れないと思うんだ

translation.en: They're not the type of songs we're looking for.
translation.ja: 曲調がちょっと…

translation.en: Mr. Sturdyvant, sir. I done already got my band picked out.
translation.ja: もうバンドも選んである

translation.en: I got some real good fellas. They know how to play real good music.
translation.ja: いい音楽を作れる メンバーです

translation.en: I know if the peoples hear the music, they'll buy it.
translation.ja: レコードは必ず売れます

translation.en: Uh, Levee, I'll be fair with you. They're not the right songs.
translation.ja: だが あれじゃダメだ

translation.en: Mr. Sturdyvant, peoples is tired of hearing jug-band music.
translation.ja: 皆 ジャグ･バンドに飽きてる

translation.en: The people in the big city? They want something with some fire to it.
translation.ja: 街では派手な曲がウケます

translation.en: Harlem, Detroit, DC.
translation.ja: ハーレムやデトロイト ＤＣでも

translation.en: Okay, I'll tell you what. I'll give you $5 apiece for 'em.
translation.ja: 分かった　１曲５ドル渡す

translation.en: I don't want $5, Mr. Sturdyvant. I wants to record them songs like you say.
translation.ja: ５ドルは要りません レコードを出したい

translation.en: Like I say, they're not the kind of songs we're looking for.
translation.ja: 今 欲しい曲じゃない

translation.en: Mr. Sturdyvant, you asked me to write them songs.
translation.ja: あなたが作曲しろと

translation.en: Why didn't you tell me that when I first give them to you?
translation.ja: 最初は気に入って―

translation.en: You told me you was gonna let me record them. What's the difference between then and now?
translation.ja: レコードを出すと 言ってくれた

translation.en: -I'll pay you for your trouble. -What's the difference?
translation.ja: 金は払う なぜ気が変わったんです？

translation.en: That's what I wanna know.
translation.ja: なぜ気が変わったんです？

translation.en: I had my fellas play your songs. When I heard them, they didn't sound like the kind I'm looking for right now.
translation.ja: うちのメンバーで試演したら イマイチだった

translation.en: You got to hear me play them. You ain't heard me play them. That's what's gonna make them sound right.
translation.ja: 俺にやらせてください シビれさせますから

translation.en: Levee, I don't doubt that. It's just that, I don't think they'd sell like Ma's records.
translation.ja: そうだろうが マ･レイニーの レコードほどは売れん

translation.en: But I'll take 'em off your hands for you.
translation.ja: 曲は買い取る

translation.en: [chuckles] Mr. Sturdyvant, sir.
translation.ja: メルさん

translation.en: I don't know what fellas you had playing them songs,
translation.ja: 誰に試演させたか知らないが 俺がやれば―

translation.en: but if I could play them, I'd set them down in the people's lap.
translation.ja: 誰に試演させたか知らないが 俺がやれば― 絶対に人々は熱くなる

translation.en: Now, you told me I could record them songs.
translation.ja: あなたも“レコードを”と

translation.en: There's nothing I can do about that.
translation.ja: だが仕方ないんだ

translation.en: Like I say, it's $5 apiece. That's what I'll pay ya.
translation.ja: だが仕方ないんだ １曲５ドルだ これでも良心的だぞ

translation.en: I'm doing you a favor.
translation.ja: １曲５ドルだ これでも良心的だぞ

translation.en: If you write any more, I'll help you out and take 'em off your hands.
translation.ja: もっと作るなら買ってやる

translation.en: The price is $5 apiece. Just like now.
translation.ja: 同じように１曲５ドルでな

translation.en: Hey, watch it, now.
translation.ja: 気をつけろ

translation.en: Shit. You stepped on my shoe.
translation.ja: 靴を踏みやがって

translation.en: Excuse me there, Levee.
translation.ja: すまん

translation.en: Look at that.
translation.ja: 見ろよ

translation.en: Nigga, you stepped on my shoe.
translation.ja: なんで俺の靴を踏む？

translation.en: -What you do that for? -Said I'm sorry.
translation.ja: なんで俺の靴を踏む？ 謝っただろ

translation.en: You gonna step on my goddamn shoe. You done fucked up my shoe.
translation.ja: よくも俺の靴を 汚してくれたな

translation.en: Look at what you done to my shoe, nigga.
translation.ja: 見ろ　このザマだ

translation.en: I ain't step on your shoe. What you wanna step on my shoe for?
translation.ja: なぜこんなことを？

translation.en: Man said he was sorry.
translation.ja: 彼は謝った

translation.en: How the hell he gonna be sorry when he done ruined my shoe?
translation.ja: だから何だ 靴を傷物にされた

translation.en: Come talk about sorry. Nigga, you stepped on my shoe, you know that?
translation.ja: 謝っただと？ 俺の靴を踏んだんだぞ

translation.en: -See what you done done? -I said, "Excuse me." Now it's over.
translation.ja: ほら見ろ 悪かったって これ以上 どうしろと？

translation.en: -What you want me to do, huh? -Wanna go and fuck up my shoe like that.
translation.ja: 悪かったって これ以上 どうしろと？ 俺はあんたの靴を踏んでない

translation.en: I ain't step on your shoe. Huh? Look at this.
translation.ja: 俺はあんたの靴を踏んでない

translation.en: -Okay, come on, now. -Naw, naw. Look at what you done.
translation.ja: 自分のしたことを 直視するがいい

translation.en: Look at that. That's my shoe. You did it. You did it!
translation.ja: 見ろよ　お前のせいで 俺の靴がメチャクチャだ

translation.en: You fucked up my shoe. You stepped on my shoe with them raggedy-ass clodhoppers.
translation.ja: あんたは俺の靴を踏んだ そのドタ靴で！

translation.en: Ain't nobody studying about you and your shoe.
translation.ja: お前もお前の靴も どうでもいい

translation.en: I said, "Excuse me." If you can't accept that, then the hell with it.
translation.ja: 謝っても許してくれないなら あきらめる

translation.en: What you want me to do?
translation.ja: 仕方ない

translation.en: You stepped on my shoe.
translation.ja: 俺の靴を踏んだ！

translation.en: He… He stepped on my shoe. He did.
translation.ja: 靴を踏みやがった

translation.en: Honest. Cutler, he stepped on my shoe.
translation.ja: 本当だ カトラー 靴を踏んだ

translation.en: What he do that for? Toledo, what you do that for?
translation.ja: なんでそんなことを？

translation.en: Cutler, help.
translation.ja: カトラー

translation.en: He stepped on my shoe. Cutler!
translation.ja: こいつは靴を踏んだ！

translation.en: It's okay, Toledo. I'll help you.
translation.ja: トレド　助けるよ

translation.en: Come on, Toledo.
translation.ja: さあ トレド

translation.en: Don't look at me like that.
translation.ja: そんな目で見るな

translation.en: Don't look at me like that.
translation.ja: そんな目で見るな…
